text: Myrica arborea (sometimes Morella arborea) is a species of plant in the Myricaceae family. A non-legume Nitrogen fixer, it is endemic to Equatorial Guinea. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests, subtropical or tropical moist montane forests, and subtropical or tropical high-altitude grassland. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== Category:Flora of Equatorial Guinea arborea Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Endemic flora of Equatorial Guinea Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Myrica arborea
